1.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jirmejah, the name of eight or nine Israelites
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

2.brief: Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
Paroh-Nekoh (or -Neko), an Egyptian king
Paroh-Nekoh (or -Neko), an Egyptian king
a king

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

Perath (i.e. Euphrates), a river of the East
Karkemish, a place in Syria
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
Nebukadnetstsar (or -retstsar, or -retstsor), king of Babylon
a king
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire
a year (as a revolution of time)
fourth; also (fractionally) a fourth
Jehojakim, a Jewish king
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Joshijah, the name of two Israelites
a king
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

3.brief: to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing)

to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

4.brief: to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
to polish; by implication, to sharpen; also to rinse
a lance (as thrown); especially the iron point
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively

5.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
concretely, crushed; also afraid; abstractly, terror
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
a retreat (literally or figuratively); abstractly, a fleeing
to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity

a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a Persian tribe
to manipulate, i.e. seize; chiefly to capture, wield, specifically, to overlay; figuratively, to use unwarrantably
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a Ludite or inhabitants of Lud (only in plural)

to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
